info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 18 at 10:40PM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Kendall, northwestern Will, southeastern Kane, DuPage and central Cook Counties through 1130 PM CDT... At 1039 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Bartlett to near Sugar Grove. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds to 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Chicago, Aurora, Naperville, Cicero, Schaumburg, Bolingbrook, Des Plaines, Berwyn, Wheaton, Oak Park, Downers Grove, Elmhurst, Lombard, Bartlett, Ohare Airport, Streamwood, Carol Stream, Romeoville, Plainfield and Hanover Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CDT for northeastern Illinois.
